result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelo Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Angelo Hicks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Angelo Hicks was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo Hicks

records.addlTxt: 1:40 PM Defendant Angelo Hicks appeared by video,  in rehab..  Attorney Aileen Henry in court for Angelo Hicks.  Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star in court for State of Wisconsin.  Clerk HM.  No objection to DE's appearance by zoom today. State is compliant with victim rights notification. Court imposes 129 days jail with credit for 129 days time served; costs ordered 30 DTP or CJ;  DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to Atty Henry. Appeal rights given.

Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court by zoom and w/ Attorney Henry.  Clerk HMcBride.  On state's motion, ct 2 is dismissed. DE enters guilty plea to cts 1.  Court finds DE guilty.   SEH 10/20 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court by zoom and w/ Attorney Henry by zoom.     Clerk HMcBride.   DE in rehab.  All cases resolved. PLEAH set over to 8/15 9am for Atty Henry to appear in person.  DE by zoom.  Bond continued.
AMENDED

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Henry.   Clerk HMcBride.  DE rejects state's global offer.  21CF1025 set for trial.  JSH 8/11 11am.  JS 8/15 830am.   PTO to be filed.  Bond continued.  Cross-referenced cases trail.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Attorney Aileen Henry in court with Defendant Angelo Hicks who appears in custody.  Clerk: PT
  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over to Br 1.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Henry.   Clerk HMcBride.   Comp report received and atty stip to findings in report.   Court finds DE competent to proceed.  PH 3/10 10am in Intake Ct.  Bond continued.
